reviewText: On my very first tail whip, I held it all the way to the ground. Landed on my side, glitched into the ground, and the point meter continued to grow. It gave me a good laugh. I restarted my bike, but I couldn't do anything because I was still doing the tail whip...and my point meter was still climbing.\n\nThat is when I uninstalled the game. I've played free games like this that worked better.
voteText: 48 of 64 people (75%) found this review helpful 13 people found this review funny

reviewText:
One thing to keep in mind here is that this game is created by a single person not a team. and ported to PC by the same single person. so with that in mind this is above and beyond any other single person dev team ive ever seen. Most cant complete a game much less do so and then port it to another system.

The menu controls seem backwards and the game is def a mobile port as you can tell.
Experienceing a glitch once is not an issue to me as I dont have the patience of a 10 year old so all the little quirks of the game literally are nothing to ruin the experience by any means nor give me a reason to make an I'm a cool kid this game is so broken" review.

If a finicky menu is enough to make you quit a game or you cant get thru the tutorial then maybe you need to reconsider if gaming is really for you.

Its no trials HD thats for sure. For a mobile port its a fine game but if you havent played trials then id go for that before trying this. Thisgame does highlight a need for more biking type games on PC. Mtn Biking and BMX games are lacking severely in all platforms of gaming but PC esp. I would really love to see a Downhill Mtn Biking or BMX game done extremely well someday but I doubt it will ever happen.

If you have the money to burn or see this in a bundle or a sale for cheap then try it out. If its your last 5$ in the world then wait for a better deal or just go eat a burger"

reviewText: If there ever was a miniclip.com clone of trials extreme, this would be it. I remember playing these sort of games for free online so it's a bit of a wonder how it ended up in my library. Is it worth full price? In my opinion no, but it would be worth a second look on sale. This game is OK but do not expect anything beyond what you see. I will recommend it but if you don't find it appealing watching the videos, I doubt you'll find it fun while playing.\n\nShred! is a linear side to side 2D sort of platformer scroller in which the player is in control of a cyclist attempting to meet goal demands by either doing tricks or getting a lot of speed and air. There are two views to choose from : first person and 3rd person from an angled side view. First person is pretty awesome but some will be disappointed in it's function. In first person view, you may be tempted into turning to the sides to explore the track but reluctantly, you'll flipping your bicycle instead. This is sort of bad because the game isn't meant to be open world but good because your obeying the laws of the game (meaning this is how it's function is based). Most likely you'll be playing in third person view in order to properly land your flips and tricks. The physics in game seem to play out properly once you get the hang of them. Holding down A" allows you to charge up your jump. In order to maximize it
date: let it go at a certain point approaching a ramp. The timing is a bit tricky but becomes sort of a fun challenge throughout the game. Using your momentum right and timing your jumps correctly brings the game up to a good speed. Once you hit this ideal speed
recommended: it's time to throw in some flips and some tricks. Tricks are done with the right joystick and are relatively easy to do and enjoyable to watch. Unfortunately when you master this
hoursPlayed: there is not a whole lot more to do than memorizing the workings of the courses. Then
voteText: it becomes easy. There are certain courses that will give you a challenge but doing the same thing over and over again may get to you. However
helpfulPercent: there are those that will find (as they unlock more courses) that they enjoy the challenge. Then again
votesHelpful:
there are those who will dislike the fact you have a button to make your player peddle up a hill that slows the game down.

The graphics are decent (at best) in the game. There are some nice backdrops (especially in first person) but nothing extremely out of the ordinary. Sounds are okay but aren't exactly diverse. Music is okay but suitable to the game.

In summary
votesTotal: it's an average game. In my own opinion
votesFunny: I believe games like this should be free simply due in part that I played games like this for free online when I was a kid. I find it increasingly odd what people can charge (but hey
commentsCount:
if someone's buying it then it all makes sense).


RATING : 6.0/10

I'm really hoping it's only my game that does this

The tutorial does a good job introducing you to the games mechanics

reviewText: Take the game for what it is, a budget title created by a single indie developer. No it's not going to win any awards for graphical fidelity, yes there are going to be some physics bugs. Given the low price of the game I think these factors can be overlooked especially when you consider how fun the game can actually be, as another reviewer has pointed out it has that one more go" mentality
date: you can attempt a short amount of time with the game
recommended: dive in and do a few runs quickly before you realise an hour has gone past.\nThe tracks themself have a good "flow" to them
hoursPlayed: providing you hit the right landings etc it's as if your line is an extension of one motion
voteText: hit them wrong and it's pretty unforgiving
helpfulPercent: there's lots of possibilities and replayability in just getting that "line" right on each trail.\nI think the game complements the Trials series pretty well and its apparent that it provided some inspiration for the title
votesHelpful: it's not as polished nor is there as much content but for the price again that can be forgiven.\nI have no hesitation in recommending the game providing you purchase it with the right attitude
votesTotal: it's definitely far from a AAA title but as a fun time distraction it serves up quite well.\nLooking forward to see what the developer brings to the table in the future."

reviewText:
Hi!

Okay so i got this game earlyer this week and i have been enjoying it allot.
I do agree that there are some issues with the game that have to be looked at: Level objectives not saving correctly, controll issues from time to time, out of bounds crashes, Launching super high after going into menu etc ...
But there is allot of positive things to this game aswell, and i am sure the negative ones can get fixed with some patches.
My favorite parts of the game: The trick system, The level design, Funny mini-Games, Flow of the track & gameplay.
The game has some kind of feel like the Trials Evolution / HD series. If you are a fan of those i can recommend this game for sure. I am also a real life mountainbike enthoasiast so that maybye helped me like this game lol :)

peace.

Little video i made of the game displaying some fun parts / some issues / some funny stuff ... enjoy!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70epgCR9pu8

reviewText: Super fun game! From pov to follow cam it's rad! Whips,\ntabletops, and lot's more of fun spins and flips. Definitely keeps the fun rolling when the rain hits!\nCheers!

reviewText: I deeply enjoy playing this game. I purchased both this version and the mobile version a long while ago, both of which I enjoyed playing through and would reccommend to anyone who enjoys biking or gaming. When playing with a controller the stick sensitivity was an issue for me, so a sensitivity bar in the options menu wouldn't go amiss (unless i've missed one somewhere), also I really like the first person camera, and spent a good half an hour-45 minutes playing 1 level over and over just because I enjoyed it so much. In order to fully enjoy this I feel that this may require some patching and control changes, such as forward and backward on the sticks on a controller, instead of left and right. Other than these small issues (and a couple of bugs, which, lets be honest, are HILARIOUS), this game is awesome and I love it to bits. :)

reviewText:
I would recommend this game to any mountain bikers out there. If you dont like mountain biking irl then I would NOT suggest this game because you probably wouldnt understand alot of the mechanics. NOTE: If you disagree with this review dont say its not helpful because thats not how that rating system works.

Pros:
Feel (once you get used to the controls its really flowy)
Challenge
Level design
Mechanics (although there not true to real life)
Animations
Tricks ( Feels ♥♥♥♥ing awsome to through huge wips and do nac nacs :D)

Cons:
Art style
Graphics
Sound
Poor optimization (no lag it just makes my amd R9 200 run really hot)
Bugs
Controls (high learning curve mainly)

reviewText:
This was made by ONE guy. Yes, it's rough as hell, yes, the graphics are a bit fugly, yes it was originally a mobile game. At its core though it's a pretty damn fun and challenging little game. Give it a chance. I feel like people are expecting a AAA Trials competitor. I certainly feel like it's worth the price as long as you are being realistic with your expectations. It was worth the cost of a late night Taco Bell run.

I put a video overview on my youtube channel for those interested in seeing it in action.
https://youtu.be/LbmmYl27nks
voteText: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Like other reviewers I too found the controls tricky at first, but after an hour of gameplay it all starts to make sense and you are rewarded with what is quite an engaging and organic game-play experience. There are a few comedy physics glitches and the menu may not be the best but considering this is made entirely by one guy the levels are pretty well designed - it's really quite good fun!\n\nFor people bashing the graphics it also looks a whole lot better than I was expecting after having watched the YouTube videos first.
